instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message:
Hi,  

I have a Macbook Air 820-3437-A. No Green light.  After cleaning up some corroded caps around U7100 it will boot from the battery and work fine.  It will not boot or charge.  Do I have bad I/O board?
Coming off the DC board I have 3.14v but when I connect it to the MB at J7000 I get a fluctuating voltage from 4v to 8v on pin 1.  Should I have more voltage coming from the I/O board.    I've tested every capacitor on the PPBUS_G3H for short but can't find one.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: The green light actually blinks every now and then. So I've searched all over and I can't find out what voltage I'm supposed to get from the I/O board.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: Hi Thx but what component should I test those pins on? U7100

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: On U7100 pin 17/18 has 3.3 and pins 27/28 has 20.5.  This is with the Fluke set to continuity mode.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: I've been doing some reading on the forum.  Should pin 3 of MLB to LIO Power Cable Connector (PP5V_S4RS3) have 5v already? Or is that created after it boots?  I know I watched a video of Louis' that explained this. Damn memory.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: PP3V42_G3H is at 0.12v so I really need to get that going first of course.  Just looking for direction if computer boots and works off battery but not charger and is not charging.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message:
From another post i see that I needed to test U6901 on the DC IN board itself.

U6091 Pin 5 (PP3V42_G3H) = 0.04v
U6091 Pin 1/2 (SMC_BC_ACOK) = .5v

Voltages at J9500

SMC_BC_ACOK = 0v

PP3v42_G3H = 0.028v

SYS_ONEWIRE = .46v

DC board has pins 1/2 at 3.2v

So I know I need to get PP3v42 back to the DC board or get that working first.  The low voltage means a short somewhere but just on the PP3V42?   I'll look at every cap and resistor on that line then or should I be focused on something else?

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: Saw R7180 looked bad so I replaced it.  Now it will boot from charger but no green light still.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: Ok now once I put the I/O cable on I get an orange light.  I'm going to put it all back and see if it will boot and charge.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message: FIXED!  One little resistor can do so much.  R7180 was the culprit.

threads.title: Not Charging but works from battery H20 damage Macbook air
threads.message:
What I'd like to figure out is why that resistor created that situation and how I would have found it or even known to look for that.  Looks like it was on CHGR_SGATE_DIV and PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH
.  Well all I can say is that I was having an issue with PPBUS_G3H and that the computer would work on battery and not Charger so looks like I'll be looking into those two things above.  If anyone has some info to share please do.
